info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central McDowell, central Caldwell and Burke Counties through 615 PM EST... At 545 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marion, moving northeast at 100 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Morganton, Marion, Sawmills, Valdese, Gamewell, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Drexel and Glen Alpine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for western North Carolina.
